What time do provincial offences court offices open?
responses:
Provincial offences court offices are open Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm.

Here's a link for the provincial offences court offices page.

patterns: How do I pay my parking ticket?
how can I pay for my parking tickets?
how can I pay for my parking tickets?
responses:
Accepted payment options: Visa, MasterCard, Visa Debit, Mastercard Debit, American Express

Unaccepted payment options: pre-paid or reloadable cards or gift cards

You can find more information about ticket payments from the following link

patterns: How do I review a parking ticket?
How do I review a parking ticket?
I want to review a parking ticket.
responses: You can review your parking ticket by submitting a parking ticket review request application

patterns: How can I request a trial date?
How do I request a trial date?
responses:
If you would like to request a trial date, complete the Notice of Intention to Appear (NIA) form.

Trial Request Updates: If your request for trial is approved, you will receive a trial date in the mail. To find out the status of your case, please visit the Provincial Court Look-up Tool

patterns: How can I find a mental health professional right for my child or myself?
responses: Feeling comfortable with the professional you or your child is working with is critical to the success of your treatment. Finding the professional who best fits your needs may require some research.

patterns: Can I pay for my parking on foot?
Where can I pay for my parking on foot?
Can I pay for parking on foot?
responses:
You can Pay on Foot at the following City parking lots:

  • 141 Clarence Street
  • 70 Clarence Street
  • 110 Laurier Avenue West

Payment methods: Cash (25¢, $1, $2 coins and bills) and credit cards

The following link shows you how to pay on foot pay on foot.

patterns: Where can I find the parking map?
Do you have a parking map?
responses: The following link shows you the parking map.

patterns: How to use a Pay and Display machine?
How do I use a pay and display machines?
responses:
1. Make payment using one of the the following methods:
    1. Insert coins into the slot until the display shows the desired parking time.
    2. Insert your credit card with the magnetic stripe down and to the right and quickly remove it. Press the blue button on the left to purchase time in 25¢ increments, until the screen displays the desired parking time. Press the blue button on the right to purchase the maximum parking time.
  2. Press the green button to print your receipt.
  3. Take the receipt from the bottom right slot of the dispenser.
  4. Place the receipt on the dashboard of your vehicle with the expiration time in plain view.

The following link will give you more information about pay and display machines.

patterns: How to pay for parking by phone?
How do I pay for parking by phone?
responses:
1. Register for an account:
    1. Visit PayByPhone.com.
    2. Download the iPhone or Android app.
    3. Call 613-691-1700.
  2. Provide your phone number, credit card number and license plate number.
  3. After parking, visit PayByPhone.com, open the app on your phone or call 613-691-1700.
  4. Enter your parking location number, found on a sticker on the side of the closest Pay and Display parking machine on the side of the street that you parked.
  5. Select the amount of time you would like to park. Parking time is not transferable to other locations.
  6. To extend your parking session, visit PayByPhone.com, open the app on your phone or call 613-691-1700.

patterns: How to find my car if it was towed?
